item.title: Bridging the Gap~ November 4th, 2019: Soul Symphony
item.description: This show is based around a long 30 minute song from The Three Sounds called Soul Symphony... and the music is going to follow suite weaving in and out of Jazz, Downtempo, and Indie with a little strings.
item.itunes:summary: This show is based around a long 30 minute song from The Three Sounds called Soul Symphony... and the music is going to follow suite weaving in and out of Jazz, Downtempo, and Indie with a little strings.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ November 1st, 2019: Early November Bliss
item.description: Kicking off the 1st of November with a warm blend of indie rock and deep house.
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off the 1st of November with a warm blend of indie rock and deep house.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ October 31st, 2019 ~ Alternative Halloween
item.description:
You've heard it before: the "typical" Halloween playlist that gets recycled at every haunted house and costume party. Well, not here on Bridging the Gap.
Instead, we'll be playing weird, obscure, alternative and eclectic tracks rife with macabre, spooky and general ghastly imagery.
item.itunes:summary:
You've heard it before: the "typical" Halloween playlist that gets recycled at every haunted house and costume party. Well, not here on Bridging the Gap.
Instead, we'll be playing weird, obscure, alternative and eclectic tracks rife with macabre, spooky and general ghastly imagery.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~October 29th, 2019: 2 Days Before Halloween
item.description: It's a couple of days before Halloween, but why not start getting into the mood? Tonight's show is a collection of various dark-themed tracks - find something for your Halloween party or to play in the back while you pass out candy to all the eager trick-or-treaters.
item.itunes:summary: It's a couple of days before Halloween, but why not start getting into the mood? Tonight's show is a collection of various dark-themed tracks - find something for your Halloween party or to play in the back while you pass out candy to all the eager trick-or-treaters.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 30th, 2019: Halloween
item.description: It's Halloween and we're listening to songs to get you in the mood for for spooks, candy and other unholy delights... with an eclectic blend of Rock, Americana and Classical.
item.itunes:summary: It's Halloween and we're listening to songs to get you in the mood for for spooks, candy and other unholy delights... with an eclectic blend of Rock, Americana and Classical.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 28th, 2019: Warm Soul, Downtempo + Jazz
item.description: Warming up with some modern soul, downtempo and bossa for this session of Bridging the Gap
item.itunes:summary: Warming up with some modern soul, downtempo and bossa for this session of Bridging the Gap

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 25th, 2019: Global Eclectic w/ a Twist of 80's
item.description: Jumping around world music and just a little 80's flair for this session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: Jumping around world music and just a little 80's flair for this session of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ October 24th, 2019 ~ Obscure and Esoteric Lyrics
item.description:
If you've ever seen "Walk Hard," a 2007 film which parody's the musician biopic genre, you might remember a scene where the movie's lead sings a ridiculously arcane tune which obviously imitates some of Bob Dylan's early style. The opening lyrics go "Mailboxes drip like lampposts in the twisted birth canal of the coliseum..."
Ridiculous, right? Well, how fun would it be to play an entire show chock full of tracks with weird, esoteric and downright incomprehensible lyrics? Let's find out.
item.itunes:summary:
If you've ever seen "Walk Hard," a 2007 film which parody's the musician biopic genre, you might remember a scene where the movie's lead sings a ridiculously arcane tune which obviously imitates some of Bob Dylan's early style. The opening lyrics go "Mailboxes drip like lampposts in the twisted birth canal of the coliseum..."
Ridiculous, right? Well, how fun would it be to play an entire show chock full of tracks with weird, esoteric and downright incomprehensible lyrics? Let's find out.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 23rd, 2019: The Gin Listen 2
item.description: HPR's Generation Listen Group is celebrating their 2nd anniversary by turning HPR studios into a vintage prohibition-era speakeasy... and they asked me to soundtrack one of the rooms. So tonight's show is part 2 of a sneak peak of the playlist filled with vintage jazz, early rhumba, a little tango and more.
item.itunes:summary: HPR's Generation Listen Group is celebrating their 2nd anniversary by turning HPR studios into a vintage prohibition-era speakeasy... and they asked me to soundtrack one of the rooms. So tonight's show is part 2 of a sneak peak of the playlist filled with vintage jazz, early rhumba, a little tango and more.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~October 22nd, 2019: It's Raining Men
item.description: Two weeks ago I did an all-women's voices themed show. Tonight we're bringing balance back to the universe and highlighting some of my favorite male voices in music. Definitely not a definitive list of male voices, but just a sampler based on some of my favorite smooth crooners.
item.itunes:summary: Two weeks ago I did an all-women's voices themed show. Tonight we're bringing balance back to the universe and highlighting some of my favorite male voices in music. Definitely not a definitive list of male voices, but just a sampler based on some of my favorite smooth crooners.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 21st, 2019: Quiet Says the Shark
item.description: The name in the title just sounds cool. Truth is that I'm still a little loopy from giving blood this afternoon. So this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a mellow and jazzy with little pockets of world music.
item.itunes:summary: The name in the title just sounds cool. Truth is that I'm still a little loopy from giving blood this afternoon. So this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a mellow and jazzy with little pockets of world music.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 18th, 2019: LatinHouseDiscoFunkLand
item.description: Keeping the music pulsing for this session of Bridging the Gap with little pockets of house fueled latin, jazz and soul.
item.itunes:summary: Keeping the music pulsing for this session of Bridging the Gap with little pockets of house fueled latin, jazz and soul.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ October 17th, 2019 ~ Acid, Psych and Garage
item.description: Tonight on Bridging the Gap, we'll be going back to the murky, acid-drenched origins of garage rock, psychedelic rock, and early hard rock. Expect to hear primarily lesser-known cuts from early garage rockers and foreign trailblazers (with a few modern tracks here and there). Best enjoyed at high volume.
item.itunes:summary: Tonight on Bridging the Gap, we'll be going back to the murky, acid-drenched origins of garage rock, psychedelic rock, and early hard rock. Expect to hear primarily lesser-known cuts from early garage rockers and foreign trailblazers (with a few modern tracks here and there). Best enjoyed at high volume.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~October 15th, 2019: Indigenous People's Day Round 2 - Hawaiʻi
item.description: On last night's edition of Bridging The Gap, dj mr.nick curated a show in honor of Indigenous Peoples day, but he graciously forgot the one indigenous people that I happen to be an expert on: Hawaiians. So tonight's Bridging The Gap is the Hawaiian edition of last night's Indigenous Peoples show honoring ka poʻe ʻoiwi o nei paeʻāina. Ola nā iwi!
item.itunes:summary: On last night's edition of Bridging The Gap, dj mr.nick curated a show in honor of Indigenous Peoples day, but he graciously forgot the one indigenous people that I happen to be an expert on: Hawaiians. So tonight's Bridging The Gap is the Hawaiian edition of last night's Indigenous Peoples show honoring ka poʻe ʻoiwi o nei paeʻāina. Ola nā iwi!

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 16th, 2019: Indie Outing
item.description: Indie Rock, sometimes know as College Rock is the backbone of AAA radio, which is the foundation of this show. It's also something that I don't always pay that much attention to although is so much good music coming out all the time. So this session of Bridging the Gap will focus on some of my favorites, both old and new.
item.itunes:summary: Indie Rock, sometimes know as College Rock is the backbone of AAA radio, which is the foundation of this show. It's also something that I don't always pay that much attention to although is so much good music coming out all the time. So this session of Bridging the Gap will focus on some of my favorites, both old and new.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 14th, 2019: Indigenous People/Struggle Sounds
item.description: Happy Indigenous Peoples' Day! Tonight's song selection is going to reflect the progress of 1st Nations and other people in this country struggling to attain freedom, and a reminder that we are all illegal.
item.itunes:summary: Happy Indigenous Peoples' Day! Tonight's song selection is going to reflect the progress of 1st Nations and other people in this country struggling to attain freedom, and a reminder that we are all illegal.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 11th, 2019: Tropical Hop
item.description: Light and tropical for this session of Bridging the Gap. The perfect get-you-up and get-you-out-the-door and to the beach or nightclub playlist.
item.itunes:summary: Light and tropical for this session of Bridging the Gap. The perfect get-you-up and get-you-out-the-door and to the beach or nightclub playlist.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ August 29th ~ World Music Cheer Up
item.description: It seems like another week of heavy news stories emerging all across the globe, so to remedy that somewhat we'll be playing some world music here on Bridging the Gap tonight. Tons of afrobeat, psychedelic and soul from the four corners of our hectic world.
item.itunes:summary: It seems like another week of heavy news stories emerging all across the globe, so to remedy that somewhat we'll be playing some world music here on Bridging the Gap tonight. Tons of afrobeat, psychedelic and soul from the four corners of our hectic world.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~ October 9th, 2019: The Gin Listen
item.description: HPR's Generation Listen Group is celebrating their 2nd anniversary by turning HPR studios into a vintage prohibition-era speakeasy... and they asked me to soundtrack one of the rooms. So tonight's show is a sneak peak of the playlist filled with vintage jazz, early rhumba and more.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~October 8th, 2019: Honoring Women's Voices
item.description: Inspired by NPR's "Turning The Table: 8 Women Who Invented American Popular Music" piece, tonight's show honors the 8 women that the piece centers around (Bessie Smith, Billie Holiday, Maybelle Carter, Ella Fitzgerald, Marian Anderson, Rosetta Tharpe, Celia Cruz, and Mary Lou Williams) along with other female artists, old and new, whose music draws inspiration from them in one way or another.
item.itunes:summary: Inspired by NPR's "Turning The Table: 8 Women Who Invented American Popular Music" piece, tonight's show honors the 8 women that the piece centers around (Bessie Smith, Billie Holiday, Maybelle Carter, Ella Fitzgerald, Marian Anderson, Rosetta Tharpe, Celia Cruz, and Mary Lou Williams) along with other female artists, old and new, whose music draws inspiration from them in one way or another.
